title: Which team will win the 2018 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Championship?
possible_answers: A team from the Albany region
A team from the Kansas City region
A team from the Spokane region
A team from the Lexington region
correct_answer: A team from the Spokane region
preds: Notre Dame is playing Mississippi St in the final. ND beat the best team in the country (UConn). Final is being played in Columbus, OH, which is closer to ND's campus.

Slight edge to Notre Dame mainly based upon power rankings including strength of schedule. Will need to shoot well against Miss. State. http://www.rpiratings.com/womrate.php https://www.masseyratings.com/cbw/ncaa-d1/ratings
Great Final Four games. Should have read my own previous forecast's comment more closely...

The all-top-seeds final suggests that favorite UConn must execute/play well to win. The most pressure would seem to be on them (to do so).  FWIW, UConn has won the last seven meetings with (Friday's) rival Notre Dame. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connecticut%E2%80%93Notre_Dame_women%27s_basketball_rivalry

Notre Dame withstood a challenge from Oregon, and -- as established rivals -- will play tough against UConn.   http://www.rpiratings.com/womensrpi.php http://www.espn.com/womens-college-basketball/team/_/id/97/louisville-cardinals

On paper, Louisville currently has perhaps the "easiest" path to the Final Four at this point, Notre Dame and Miss. St., potentially more difficult. (Though Oregon St. is playing well.) Highly-ranked potential Final Four teams Louisville, Notre Dame and UCLA have all lost their game with UConn during the regular season, as has upcoming UConn opponent South Carolina. http://www.rpiratings.com/womensrpi.php http://www.uconnhuskies.com/sports/w-baskbl/sched/conn-w-baskbl-sched.html

UConn's recent record in the round of 16: 23-2 (25 straight appearances). 
Temporary 'bump-up' to their chances for now; will re-evaluate after the weekend games. http://www.courant.com/sports/uconn-womens-basketball/hc-sp-uconn-women-20180322-story.html http://www.rpiratings.com/womensrpi.php

It's become a poker table here, so I'm following the all ins (albeit to 95% not 100).  Notre Dame or Connecticut? Can ND beat Texas A&M? Are the UConn Huskies just too good, going for 12th title since they're undefeated on 34-0 and breaking records left & right (140 pts in a game is awesome beating St Francis PA by 88 pts! 140-52 in round 1).

..UConn is powerful but one bad game at the wrong time can still sink them... http://www.rpiratings.com/womensrpi.php https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/ncaaw/2018/03/12/ncaa-womens-tournament-once-again-they-chasing-uconn/418299002/

UCONN's tam this year may be its most dominant lineup ever.  Only Miss St has an outside shot to upset them.  But based on UCONN's historic dismantling of St Francis yesterday, I believe a UCONN championship as is close to a lock as one will ever have in sports.
